boat.name: Hypatia
boat.full_description:
Built in 1896 at Blackwall, London in teak on oak, with laid pine decks, 'Hypatia' was originally a centreboard yacht, drawing 3'. She is believed to have been sold to Russia in 1936, and returned after the war.

In 1956 the centreboard was removed and deadwood added by Moody's. In the early 1960s she was owned by a Mr. Rose of Otterbourne and regularly entered in the Solent Old Gaffers Race winning third prize in 1962. Mr. Rose sold her to Mr Alexander Smith of Frinton who entered the East Coast Race, winning first in Class I in 1968, and, third in 1969.

In 1970 she was owned and raced by T F Emmons and R J Woods of Little Horkesley.

She has been owned since 1972 by Mike King.
boat.construction_details: Teak carvel planking on oak sawn and bent frames
boat.short_description: Built in teak on oak, with laid pine decks, 'Hypatia' was originally a centreboard yacht, drawing 3'. She is believed to have been sold to Russia in 1936, and returned after the war.

for_sales.sales_text:
Built at Blackwall, London, in 1896 and in the same ownership since 1972, this beauty must be sold due to ill health.

39" overall, 5"6' draught. Sleeps four. Sails well and in very good condition.
for_sales.summary: Built at Blackwall, London, in 1896 and in the same ownership since 1972, this beauty must be sold due to ill health.
